app.subtitle: Image Annotation Tool with IoT Integration

dashboard.title: AI Model Project Workflow
dashboard.subtitle: Seamless integration with NE301 devices, complete solution from data collection to model deployment
dashboard.getDevice: Get NeoEyes NE301 AI Camera Device

workflow.title: Complete Workflow
workflow.description: Six key steps from device data collection to model deployment

step1.title: Device Data Collection
step1.description: NE301 devices collect image data in real-time through built-in cameras, supporting various scenarios and lighting conditions

step2.title: Upload Images to Annotation Space
step2.description: Quickly upload collected image data to the annotation space, supporting batch upload and automatic management

step3.title: Quick Image Annotation
step3.description: Rich annotation tools supporting bounding boxes, polygons, keypoints, and more annotation methods for fast data labeling

step4.title: Train Model
step4.description: Based on YOLOv8 framework, train models using annotated data, supporting various model sizes and training parameter configurations

step5.title: Quantize and Export Model
step5.description: Quantize and optimize trained models, generating TFLite format models and NE301 device-specific configuration JSON files

step6.title: Rapid Deployment to NE301
step6.description: One-click compilation to generate model packages usable by NE301 devices, supporting rapid deployment and updates, achieving end-to-end closed loop

advantages.title: Features & Advantages
advantages.description: Why choose our AI Model Project solution

speed.title: Fast & Efficient
speed.description: End-to-end automation from data collection to model deployment, significantly reducing development cycles

accuracy.title: Precise Annotation
accuracy.description: Professional annotation tools and workflows ensure data quality and improve model performance

integration.title: Seamless Integration
integration.description: Deep integration with NE301 devices, one-stop solution for data collection, training, and deployment

reliability.title: Stable & Reliable
reliability.description: Proven model optimization and deployment processes ensure stability in production environments

modelSpace.jsonInputHint: Enter class names in JSON array format, e.g.: ["person", "car", "bicycle"]

mqtt.title: MQTT
mqtt.serviceDisabled: MQTT service is disabled. Please enable MQTT service in server configuration.
mqtt.usingBuiltin: Using Built-in MQTT Broker (Mosquitto), automatically configured by the system. You can also add external Broker in System Settings.
mqtt.usingExternal: Currently using External MQTT Broker. You can configure multiple external Brokers or manage built-in Broker in System Settings.
mqtt.brokerNotConfigured: MQTT Broker is not configured. Please configure built-in or external MQTT Broker in System Settings.
mqtt.configHint: üí° Tip: You can manage MQTT Broker (built-in/external), TLS certificates, device certificates, and other configurations in System Settings ‚Üí MQTT Configuration.
mqtt.deviceAccessHint: üì± Device Access: Devices can automatically obtain MQTT Broker access information by accessing {{server}}/api/device/bootstrap, no manual configuration needed.
mqtt.configInSystemSettings: Please check and configure MQTT Broker in System Settings:
mqtt.builtinStartFailed: Built-in MQTT Broker failed to start, please check:
mqtt.externalRequired: This system requires an external MQTT Broker, please install and start:
mqtt.runMosquittoDocker: # Run Mosquitto (foreground, press Ctrl+C to stop)

troubleshooting.checkSystemSettings: Check MQTT Broker configuration in System Settings
troubleshooting.checkAddress: Check if Broker address and port configuration are correct
troubleshooting.checkFirewall: Confirm firewall is not blocking port {{port}}
troubleshooting.checkDocker: If using Docker, ensure ports are correctly mapped
troubleshooting.checkAuth: Check if MQTT username and password are correct (if authentication is configured)
troubleshooting.checkTLS: If using MQTTS, check if TLS certificate configuration is correct
troubleshooting.checkBuiltinEnabled: Confirm built-in Broker is enabled in System Settings
troubleshooting.checkBuiltinPort: Check if built-in Broker port {{port}} is occupied
troubleshooting.checkBuiltinTLS: If using MQTTS, check if CA certificate and server certificate are correctly configured
troubleshooting.checkBuiltinAuth: Check built-in Broker username and password configuration (if anonymous connection is disabled)
troubleshooting.checkExternalConfigured: Confirm external Broker is added and enabled in System Settings
troubleshooting.checkExternalAddress: Check if external Broker address configuration is correct
troubleshooting.checkExternalPort: Check if external Broker port {{port}} is accessible
troubleshooting.checkExternalAuth: Check if external Broker username and password are correct
troubleshooting.checkExternalTLS: If using MQTTS, check if CA certificate, client certificate, and key are correctly configured

usage.title: Usage Instructions
usage.getBootstrap: (Recommended) Device calls Bootstrap API to get access information:
usage.format: Message format is JSON, containing image data (Base64 encoded)
usage.autoSave: Server will automatically save images to current project

response.title: Response Description
response.description: Server will return response message in Topic

settings.title: System Settings

builtinBroker.title: Built-in MQTT Broker Management
builtinBroker.requireClientCertDesc: mTLS enabled: All clients must provide valid client certificates to connect (more secure)
builtinBroker.requireClientCertDescOff: Server certificate verification only: Clients only need CA certificate to connect (consistent with external Broker behavior)
builtinBroker.caCert: CA Certificate (Shared by Broker and Clients)
builtinBroker.caCertDesc: CA certificate used to verify client certificates and server certificates
builtinBroker.clientConnectionDesc: Configuration for AIToolStack as a client connecting to the built-in Broker (automatically managed)
builtinBroker.certManagementDesc: Manage generated device client certificates. All certificates are signed by the global CA. You can use the same certificate for multiple devices or generate independent certificates for each device.
builtinBroker.noCertificates: No certificates yet. Click the "Generate Client Certificate" button above to generate one.
builtinBroker.deleteCertConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the certificate for device "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.
builtinBroker.deleteCertSuccess: Certificate for device "{{name}}" has been deleted

externalBroker.title: External MQTT Broker Management
externalBroker.subtitle: Support adding multiple external MQTT Brokers. The system will connect to all enabled Brokers simultaneously.
externalBroker.noBrokers: No external Brokers yet. Click the "Add Broker" button above to add one.
externalBroker.name: Name
externalBroker.caCertPlaceholder: Upload CA certificate or enter path
externalBroker.clientCertPlaceholder: Upload client certificate or enter path
externalBroker.clientKeyPlaceholder: Upload client private key or enter path
externalBroker.testFirst: Please test connection successfully before saving
externalBroker.fillRequired: Please fill in required fields: Name, Address, Port
externalBroker.fillAddressPort: Please fill in Broker address and port first
externalBroker.cannotConnectToBroker: Cannot connect to {{host}}:{{port}}, please check if the address and port are correct
externalBroker.testBeforeSave: Please click the "Test Connection" button to verify the connection. Only successful connections can add Broker
externalBroker.testFailedBeforeSave: Connection test failed. Please fix the configuration and test again. Only successful connections can add Broker

certificate.commonNameDescAIToolStack: Used to identify AIToolStack client certificate
certificate.commonNameDescDevice: Used to identify device. It is recommended to use device unique identifier (e.g., device-1, device-2, etc.)
certificate.descriptionAIToolStack: This certificate is only used for AIToolStack to connect to Broker
certificate.descriptionAIToolStack2: Generating will overwrite the existing AIToolStack client certificate
certificate.descriptionDevice: Each device needs its own certificate (signed by the same CA)
certificate.descriptionDevice2: Certificates will be saved as separate files (client-{CN}.crt/key) and will not overwrite each other
certificate.descriptionDevice3: After generation, you can view and download in the "Certificate Management" area
certificate.validityDaysRequired: Please enter valid certificate validity period (days)

settings.protocolDesc: Determines the port Broker listens on: MQTT (1883) or MQTTS (8883)
settings.autoDetect: Auto-detected (can be configured via MQTT_BROKER_HOST environment variable)
settings.clientQos: Client QoS setting (independent of Broker configuration)
settings.clientKeepalive: Client Keepalive setting (independent of Broker configuration)
settings.loadBrokerListFailed: Failed to load external Broker list
settings.loadConfigFailed: Failed to load MQTT configuration. Please check backend service.
settings.deleteBrokerConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this Broker?
settings.usernamePasswordRequired: Username and password must be set when anonymous connection is disabled

deviceAccess.title: Device Access Information
deviceAccess.subtitle: Guidance for devices on how to connect to MQTT Broker and backend service.
deviceAccess.hintText: Devices only need to access the HTTP service above and call /api/device/bootstrap to automatically obtain the same access information, avoiding manual IP and port lookup in the local network.

settings.subtitle: Configure MQTT service and device access for local networking and debugging.
